meanings.definition: An unborn or unhatched offspring in the early stages of development.
meanings.sent1: The embryo of the bird was still inside the egg.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the embryo to understand its growth.
meanings.sent3: The embryo in the nest seemed to be playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her idea was just an embryo waiting to bloom into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The embryo's tiny heart was a symbol of new life.

meanings.definition: A rudimentary or undeveloped form of something.
meanings.sent1: The embryo of the plan was sketched out on a napkin.
meanings.sent2: The project was just an embryo of what it could become.
meanings.sent3: The embryo of a joke made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His talent was an embryo waiting to be discovered by the world.
meanings.sent5: The embryo of an idea grew into a successful business.
